comments.body: I wish for the same thing when it comes to prismarine
or maybe from wandering traders
Maybe from Piglins bartering so it is still Nether-exclusive.
Or possibly through piglin bartering as well

It makes sense to me to have it be craftable with basalt for some reason. Maybe 2 basalt 2 cobblestone -> 4 blackstone? Or basalt and black dye? It would be nice to be able to get it in mass quantities with just as much effort as basalt.

Maybe for prismarine -> 23 emeralds 12 prismarine shards min.
blackstone -> piglin barter (9.8%)
Both blackstone and prismarine are renewable, this post is now obsolete :)
YES!!! they should just attach to 2 blocks
yeah, cant they have the textures connect so the border only goes along the side connected to other, non glass blocks? I'm pretty sure that's how glass used to be.

Just to add more Information

I'm wondering if a crafting plan of 1x Bucket of Lava surrounded by 8x Iron Ingots could work? If thats too expensive we could always switch out for water instead of lava, or switch down to Iron Nuggets - If its too cheap we could up it to 8x Iron Blocks



It could possibly be found naturally spawning around lava pockets instead of gold ore, as the temperature near the lava is hot enough to melt the ore down into liquid gold, or it could just be only craftable by players and NOT naturally forming, to seperate it into more of a design option than a resource you need

No, I think you should have to smelt a gold block or ingot in a blast furnace and stick a bucket on the right side slot. You can ONLY use a blast furnace because its incredibly hot. I hope this becomes real.
Yep. Your recipe could work pretty good actually, and give more reason to use the blast furnace
Soul sand does this
That would be awesome for like a sky city demension
Or maybe if you apply bonemeal to the base of a tree it will make more leaves or grow into a giant tree like one of those jungle trees if enough bonemeal is applied.
I like the idea of blocks that spiders can't climb but there is a simpler solution to that particular problem: add a roof.
Maybe ice blocks and ice variants could be used to stop them from climbing. I don't really how spiders can climb ice anyway.
basterebbe rendere il ghiaccio (dato che è scivoloso) il blocco che i ragni non possono salire
Like in real life
Then what is the difference with give another player a book?
You can just use a book.
The difference would be that this requires less resources. Also, it'd be more realistic and atmospheric for adventure maps.
I think it would feel more special as well. <3
I don't think it is necessary to add new items, just turn the paper of the synthetic book into the paper with writing function, or replace it.

This is a great idea, and I posted a similar idea which is the golden amulet, which would be an accessory or an upgrade to the netherite armour. However, rather than having an unenchantable elytra as a balancer, I think it should slightly decrease the speed of the elytra, and only making high speeds achievable via rockets.
Sounds like more of an iron bar door like a prison cell than a screen door.
True. I changed the name to barred door.
This enchant could go on a crossbow maybe, instead of a sword.

They can only suck up one mob at a time, so it's not optimal for taking on hoards in a combat situation. 

Your best drops from the plant are going to be coming from endermen. It does not work on mobs that have the speed effect, or boss mobs. 

If you're not careful, it may try to eat you too!
What if you break the obsidian with a wooden pickaxe and finish with a diamond pickaxe? Will it break? What happens to the durability?
I agree with TheCamelCamCan. I feel like this will be exploitable. No vote.

To respond to TheCamelCamCan and Marthinus, durability on an item doesn't go down until the block is actually broken. Therefore, almost breaking the obsidian with a wooden pick and then switching to a diamond at the end would have the same effect on durability as only using the diamond pick would. It would only serve to waste your time.

Ok it resets if you mine it with a different tool

thanks Marthinus and TheCamelCamCan
How if there is a creeper blow up that block when youre mining

@TheCamelCamCan:

At first, i like this idea. Then i realizes it would be exploitable. I think you meant start with a diamond pickaxe then finish with a wooden one to save time and not waste durability on the precious diamond one. However, I think that this feature could still be implemented, as I hate having to start over punching a hard block, because it is not too exploitable or a feature could be made where the tool durability is reduced when mining is started. However, saving another int variable to every single block and a timer that counts down for the block regenerating in the NBT would take storage, RAM, processing speed, and possibily even a new required NBT format for efficiency which I’m SURE would be a pain in the backside for Mojang. Unless there is a good solution to all this, I think we just leave it as is and focus on important features, like Bedrock Edition being fixed :/
Great idea
Interesting mechanic. I love it! My only problem though is maybe replace larvae with a type of leech?
Great idea
This is an awesome idea, it would add realism, immersion, and give players who just can't find slimes a good way to get slimeballs!
I love it! Many a twisted ankle running across slimy logs
The crafting recipe should be blocks, maybe something like gold nuggets and quartz surrounding a magma ball

380228077192 yes that is a very good idea. But I believe that it should be full gold ingots(not hard to make with all the nether gold) and the middle should still be a pearl(because it is an eye, just like the regular one, and it should be somewhat consistent throughout variants). I will edit the post.
I don't think this is a good idea, like the budding amethyst blocks it would be better for the game to have the player build a farm on site.

Having to make outsourced farms in specific circumstances is a big part of the challenge and tradeoff of spawner mob farms, and it give you another reason to leave your base late game, which is always good.
I think this Effects Gems can be used with Beacon, so that Beacon's effects can be turned on more than 2 effects at a time

This could be part of the Cave Update. Ooh! Got an idea: What if you could convert the gems into necklaces, which would go in a new armor spot: Necklaces. This would provide the effect when worn. Also, maybe we could do the same thing with bracelets?
I think it'd be better if you could decide the order on a specific tool. Maybe Shift+Right Clicking with it on your hand or something.
Snow and Ice should melt.

Yes precisely! This could even give an opportunity to make a new block in the nether that replaces ice for boat transport. It could be Pitch Tar, a new block part of a new nether biome post I shared called Tar Pits.
The buff would be permanent right? Bottles o' enchanting are kinda rare...
Bottles o' enchanting are easy to get if you level up a cleric, so probably not a permanent buff.

A small boost via a potion for enchantments would be a really good idea. However, times two is too much. It would create insanely overpowered tools, weapons and armour. It should also only boost one enchantment at a time and only by potentially 10% for a maximum of 8 minutes.
I have a name for that; Potion of Duplication
And because the items are so powerful, it should take a long time to have them done.
Yes i will add that
This is actually very brilliant. Please add this! <--- To the devs.
I would say it calms down the piglins for a moment
I'd rather just craft stuff normally, as outlined in my post "netherite 'upgrading' is lame".
the upgrading is going to be done in a smithing table and i believe you keep your enchantments as well

maybe a new type of ice !? 
sponges already generate in monuments , so what if the elder guardian instead of dropping a sponge , it would drop a "ice core" item that when you surround it with 4 blue ice & 4 sponges you get the "lava sponge" 
and it would be the oppsite of the spongs , and you dry it when you place it in water ..
Good Idea! Maybe The Lava Could Turn Into Magma, So You Can Get It Without having To Go To The Nether!
